meanings.definition: A book of maps or charts.
meanings.sent1: I used an atlas to find the capital of France.
meanings.sent2: The atlas on the shelf helped me navigate through the city.
meanings.sent3: The atlas fell off the table and opened to a map of a mysterious island.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an atlas of knowledge, with each page representing a different subject.
meanings.sent5: The atlas was filled with colorful maps that sparked my curiosity.

meanings.definition: A large muscle in the upper back and neck.
meanings.sent1: The atlas muscle helps us move our head from side to side.
meanings.sent2: After exercising, I could feel my atlas muscle getting sore.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his atlas muscle was so strong, he could lift a car with his neck.
meanings.sent4: Her tension was like a heavy weight on her atlas muscle, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The atlas muscle is crucial for maintaining good posture and preventing neck pain.

meanings.definition: A Titan condemned to support the heavens on his shoulders.
meanings.sent1: In Greek mythology, Atlas was punished to hold up the sky.
meanings.sent2: The story of Atlas carrying the heavens is a famous myth.
meanings.sent3: Atlas must have the strongest shoulders in the world to bear the weight of the sky.
meanings.sent4: She felt like Atlas, carrying the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of Atlas holding the heavens is a powerful symbol of endurance and strength.
